fields.summary: Job might get stuck in restoreState() from HDFS due to interrupt

fields.summary: DomainSocketWatcher::add()/delete() should not self interrupt while looping await()

comments.body: One possible fix is to call {{awaitUninterruptibly()}} instead of {{await()}}.

Hmm.. the reason we are interrupting the thread in question is because we want it to be interrupted (because the work it's performing is no longer relevant). Wouldn't this just cause it to be stuck forever anyway, or at best to continue a useless operation? cc [~sseth]

This message was automatically generated.

The wait is to ensure the domain-socket fd is added to the DomainSocketWatcher thread's collection. It is a very short wait, but important so that fd's are managed appropriately. The interrupt is not lost, {{awaitUninterruptibly}} ensures interrupt is set when it returns.

The try-await-catch-InterruptedException-interrupt is clearly a bug.  Using awaitUninterruptibly sounds good.

+1 on the patch.
Committed to {{trunk}} through {{branch-2.8}} branches. Thanks [~sershe] for discussion. Thanks [~jnp] and [~szetszwo] for review.
